gurmukhi: gwNgyX ndIAij aucry sirqj S`qRu bKwn ]sUq aucir AMqir aucir nwm bwn pihcwn ]164]
transliteration: Gadngeya Nadeeaj(i) Ouchre Saritaj Shattru Bakhaan|| Soot Ouchar(i) Antar(i) Ouchar(i) Naam Baan Paihchaan||164||
translation: Uttering the words “Gangay and Nadiaj”, then saying “Saritaj Shatru”, then uttering “Soot” and afterwards “Antari”, the names of Baan are known.164.

gurmukhi: qwlkyqu sivqw sBin Awid AMq Air dyhu ]sUq aucir irpu pun aucir nwm bwn liK lyhu ]165]
transliteration: Taalket(u) Savitaa Sabhan(i) Aadh Ant Ar(i) Deh(u)|| Soot Ouchar(i) Rip(u) Poun Ouchar(i) Naam Baan Lakh(i) Leh(u)||165||
translation: Adding the word “Ari” at the end of the words “Taalketu and Savita”, Uttering the word “Soot” and then “Ripu”, all the names of Baan are known.165.

gurmukhi: piRQm dRox kih isKX kih sUqir bhur bKwn ]nwm bwn ky skl hI lIjhu cqur pCwn ]166]
transliteration: Pritham Dron Kah(i) Sikhya Kah(i) Sootar(i) Bahur Bakhaan|| Naam Baan Ke Sakal Hileejoh Chatur Pachhaad||166||
translation: Saying primarily “Dron” and then “Shshya” and then uttering the word “Sutari”, the wise people recognize all the names of Baan.166.

gurmukhi: BwrdÍwj dRoxj ipqw aucir isKX pd dyhu ]sUqir bhur bKwnIAY nwm bwn liK lyhu ]167]
transliteration: Bhaardvaaj Dronaj Pitaa Ouchar(i) Sikhya Pad Deh(u)|| Sootar(i) Bahur Bakhaaneeai Naam Baan Lakh(i) Leh(u)||167||
translation: After uttering the word “Bhardwaj (the father of Dronaj), then adding the words “Shishya and Sutari”, the names of Baan are known.167.

gurmukhi: piRQm juiDStr BwiK bMDu Sbd puin BwKIAY ]jwn hiRdY mY rwK skl nwm ey bwn ky ]168]
transliteration: Pritham Judhishatar Bhaakh(i) Bandh(u) Shabad Poun(i) Bhaakheeai|| Jaan Hridai Mai Raakh Sakal Naam Aa Baan Ke||168||
translation: Uttering “Yudhishtar” primarily and then saying the word “Bandhu” all the names of Baan are known.168.

gurmukhi: dÍY BeIAw pMcwil piq kih puin BRwq aucwir ]suq Air kih sB bwn ky lIjo nwm suDwir ]169]
transliteration: Dvai Bhaeeaa Pandhaal(i) Pat(i) Kah(i) Poun(i) Bhraat Oucdaar(i)|| Sout Ar(i) Kah(i) Sabh Baan Ke Leejo Naam Suddaar(i)||169||
translation: After uttering the words “Bandhu and Panchali-Pati” and then adding the words “Bhrata and Sutari”, all the names of Baan are correctly known.169.

gurmukhi: Drmrwj Drmj aucir bMDu Sbd pun dyhu ]sUqir bhur bKwnIAY nwm bwn lK lyhu ]170]
transliteration: Dharmraaj Dharmaj Ouchar(i) Bandh(u) Shabad Poun Deh(u)|| Sootar(i) Bahur Bakhaaneeai Naam Baan Lakh Leh(u)||170||
translation: Uttering the words “Dharmaj and Dharamraaj” and then adding the word “Bandhu” and afterwards saying the word- “Sutari”, the names of Baan are known.170.

gurmukhi: kwlj Drmj s`l irpu kih pd bMDu bKwn ]sUqir bhuir bKwnIAY sB sr nwm pCwn ]171]
transliteration: Kaalaj Dharmaj Sall Rip(u) Kah(i) Pad Bandh(u) Bakhaan|| Sootar(i) Bahur(i) Bakhaaneeai Sabh Sar Naam Pachhaad||171||
translation: After uttering the words “Kaalaj, Dharmaj and Shalya-Ripou”, then adding the word “Banndhu” and afterwards saying “Sutari”, all the names of Baan are known.171.

gurmukhi: beI vsq pd piRQm kih puin squ Sbd bKwin ]bMDu aucir sUqir aucisB sr nwm pCwn ]172]
transliteration: Baivast Pad Pritham Kah(i) Poun(i) Sat(u) Shabad Bakhaan(i)|| Bandh(u) Ouchar(i) Sootar(i) Ouchar(i) Sabh Sar Naam Pachhaad||172||
translation: Saying the word “Vaivasvat” primarily and then uttering the words “Sat, Bandhu and Sutari” in serial order, all the names of Baan are known.172.

gurmukhi: piRQm sUrj ky nwm lY bhur puqR pd BwK ]Anuj aucr sUqir aucir nwm bwn lK rwK ]173]
transliteration: Pritham Sooraj Ke Naam Lai Bahur Poutra Pad Bhaakh|| Anuj Ouchar Sootar(i) Ouchar(i) Naam Baan Lakh Raakh||173||
translation: Uttering the names of Surya primarily and then saying the words “Putra, Anuj and Sutari” in serial order, the names of Baan are known.173.

gurmukhi: kwilMdRI ko piRQm kih pun pd Anuj bKwn ]qnuj aucr AnujwgR kih sr ky nwm pCwn ]174]
transliteration: Kaalindriko Pritham Kah(i) Poun Pad Anuj Bakhaan|| Tanuj Ouchar Anujaagra Kah(i) Sar Ke Naam Pachhaad||174||
translation: Uttering the word “Kalindri” primarily and then saying the words “Anuj, Tanuj and Anujagra”, the names of Baan are recognized.174.

gurmukhi: jmnw kwilMdRI Anuj kih suq bhur bKwn ]Anuj aucir sUqir aucir sr ky nwm pCwn ]175]
transliteration: Jamnaa Kaalindrianuj Kah(i) Sout Bahur Bakhaan|| Anuj Ouchar(i) Sootar(i) Ouchar(i) Sar Ke Naam Pachhaad||175||
translation: Saying the words”Sut, Anuj and Sutari”, after uttering the words “Yamuna, Kalindri and Anuj”, the names of Baan are known.175.
